titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-P-92
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-P-92

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

Text shown in this photograph:
1.Yuhʿān Dhubyān bin Yismāʿʾīl bin Sumhūkarib, King of Sumʿay, has dedicated to Taʾlab in Ẓubayān himself and his sons 2.Zaydum and Zaydʾīl and all of his (other) children and his property and his house of Yiʿad and his lands of Taʾliqum and all of his property (there) and the property of his father Yismāʿʾīl [and]
Restored full text:
1.Yuhʿān Dhubyān bin Yismāʿʾīl bin Sumhūkarib, King of Sumʿay, has dedicated to Taʾlab in Ẓubayān himself and his sons 2.Zaydum and Zaydʾīl and all of his (other) children and his property and his house of Yiʿad and his lands of Taʾliqum and all of his property (there) and the property of his father Yismāʿʾīl [and] the pro- 3.[perty and irrigated fields and wādī-side plots and houses and lands which the two of them had inherited from their father Sumhūʾafaq bin Sumhūyafaʿ, King of Sumʿay, in the countryside and in town; and his irrigated field of] 4.Nuʿmān which Yuhʿān had acquired and purchased from Bakrum and Hawfāʿathat and Himmatʿathat and Hawtarʿathat and from Hawtarʿathat and ʿAmmīshafaq and Yuhʿān and ʿA-] 5.[mmīsamaʿ and Ganiʾum and Ẓarrum and their brothers of the lineage of Riʾbān; and his wādī-side plot of Dhū-Sumhūʿalay on the way to the agricultural land attached to Ḥadaqān which he had gained possession of and acquired from ʿAmmīshafaq] 6.[bin Sirwam, qawl-official of Yarsum; and his wādī-side plot of Dhāt Daʾikh. And he acquired through mutual agreement its property-rights through a gift which his father and paternal uncles, the qawl-officials of Yuhaybib had bestowed, which] 7.[the kings of Mārib and the tribe of Samaʿ had bestowed: the tilled area of the wādī-side plot of Dhū-Daʾikh. And in accordance with the pact which Karibʾīl Watar, King of Sabaʾ, had established for him; and in accordance with the gift and the pact which] 8.[the tribe of Samaʿ had established and bestowed; and in accordance with pact and the edict which Yithāʿkarib bin Dharaḥʾīl bin Yuhafriʿ Dhū-ʿUrranhān had established. And (as for) his wādī-side plot of Ḥayiś … …] 9.[and acquired and gained possession of … …].

tei:div.tei:message: Caught error exerr:EXXQDY0002: Error parsing XML. Document is not valid. Fatal (12,179) : The element type "ab" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</ab>". Validated in -1 millisec. in document 1110002009.xml
tei:div.tei:text:
<ab type="formal-markup">Text shown in this photograph:
<lb n="1"/>Yuhʿān Dhubyān bin Yismāʿʾīl bin Sumhūkarib, King of Sumʿay, has dedicated to Taʾlab in Ẓubayān himself and his sons <lb n="2"/>Zaydum and Zaydʾīl and all of his <unclear>other</unclear> children and his property and his house of Yiʿad and his lands of Taʾliqum and all of his property <unclear>there</unclear> and the property of his father Yismāʿʾīl <supplied reason="lost">and</supplied>
Restored full text:
<lb n="1"/>Yuhʿān Dhubyān bin Yismāʿʾīl bin Sumhūkarib, King of Sumʿay, has dedicated to Taʾlab in Ẓubayān himself and his sons <lb n="2"/>Zaydum and Zaydʾīl and all of his <unclear>other</unclear> children and his property and his house of Yiʿad and his lands of Taʾliqum and all of his property <unclear>there</unclear> and the property of his father Yismāʿʾīl <supplied reason="lost">and</supplied> the pro- <lb n="3"/><supplied reason="lost">perty and irrigated fields and wādī-side plots and houses and lands which the two of them had inherited from their father Sumhūʾafaq bin Sumhūyafaʿ, King of Sumʿay, in the countryside and in town; and his irrigated field of</supplied> <lb n="4"/>Nuʿmān which Yuhʿān had acquired and purchased from Bakrum and Hawfāʿathat and Himmatʿathat and Hawtarʿathat and from Hawtarʿathat and ʿAmmīshafaq and Yuhʿān and ʿA-</supplied> <lb n="5"/><supplied reason="lost">mmīsamaʿ and Ganiʾum and Ẓarrum and their brothers of the lineage of Riʾbān; and his wādī-side plot of Dhū-Sumhūʿalay on the way to the agricultural land attached to Ḥadaqān which he had gained possession of and acquired from ʿAmmīshafaq</supplied> <lb n="6"/><supplied reason="lost">bin Sirwam, qawl-official of Yarsum; and his wādī-side plot of Dhāt Daʾikh. And he acquired through mutual agreement its property-rights through a gift which his father and paternal uncles, the qawl-officials of Yuhaybib had bestowed, which</supplied> <lb n="7"/><supplied reason="lost">the kings of Mārib and the tribe of Samaʿ had bestowed: the tilled area of the wādī-side plot of Dhū-Daʾikh. And in accordance with the pact which Karibʾīl Watar, King of Sabaʾ, had established for him; and in accordance with the gift and the pact which</supplied> <lb n="8"/><supplied reason="lost">the tribe of Samaʿ had established and bestowed; and in accordance with pact and the edict which Yithāʿkarib bin Dharaḥʾīl bin Yuhafriʿ Dhū-ʿUrranhān had established. And <unclear>as for</unclear> his wādī-side plot of Ḥayiś … …</supplied> <lb n="9"/><supplied reason="lost">and acquired and gained possession of … …</supplied>.</ab>

div.tei:ab:
Text shown in this photograph:
Yuhʿān Dhubyān bin Yismāʿʾīl bin Sumhūkarib, King of Sumʿay, has dedicated to Taʾlab in Ẓubayān himself and his sons
Zaydum and Zaydʾīl and all of his other children and his property and his house of Yiʿad and his lands of Taʾliqum and all of his property there and the property of his father Yismāʿʾīl and
Restored full text:
Yuhʿān Dhubyān bin Yismāʿʾīl bin Sumhūkarib, King of Sumʿay, has dedicated to Taʾlab in Ẓubayān himself and his sons
Zaydum and Zaydʾīl and all of his other children and his property and his house of Yiʿad and his lands of Taʾliqum and all of his property there and the property of his father Yismāʿʾīl and the pro-
perty and irrigated fields and wādī-side plots and houses and lands which the two of them had inherited from their father Sumhūʾafaq bin Sumhūyafaʿ, King of Sumʿay, in the countryside and in town; and his irrigated field of
Nuʿmān which Yuhʿān had acquired and purchased from Bakrum and Hawfāʿathat and Himmatʿathat and Hawtarʿathat and from Hawtarʿathat and ʿAmmīshafaq and Yuhʿān and ʿA-
mmīsamaʿ and Ganiʾum and Ẓarrum and their brothers of the lineage of Riʾbān; and his wādī-side plot of Dhū-Sumhūʿalay on the way to the agricultural land attached to Ḥadaqān which he had gained possession of and acquired from ʿAmmīshafaq
bin Sirwam, qawl-official of Yarsum; and his wādī-side plot of Dhāt Daʾikh. And he acquired through mutual agreement its property-rights through a gift which his father and paternal uncles, the qawl-officials of Yuhaybib had bestowed, which
the kings of Mārib and the tribe of Samaʿ had bestowed: the tilled area of the wādī-side plot of Dhū-Daʾikh. And in accordance with the pact which Karibʾīl Watar, King of Sabaʾ, had established for him; and in accordance with the gift and the pact which
the tribe of Samaʿ had established and bestowed; and in accordance with pact and the edict which Yithāʿkarib bin Dharaḥʾīl bin Yuhafriʿ Dhū-ʿUrranhān had established. And as for his wādī-side plot of Ḥayiś … …
and acquired and gained possession of … ….

Text shown in this photograph:
Yuhʿān Dhubyān bin Yismāʿʾīl bin Sumhūkarib, King of Sumʿay, has dedicated to Taʾlab in Ẓubayān himself and his sons
Zaydum and Zaydʾīl and all of his other children and his property and his house of Yiʿad and his lands of Taʾliqum and all of his property there and the property of his father Yismāʿʾīl and
Restored full text:
Yuhʿān Dhubyān bin Yismāʿʾīl bin Sumhūkarib, King of Sumʿay, has dedicated to Taʾlab in Ẓubayān himself and his sons
Zaydum and Zaydʾīl and all of his other children and his property and his house of Yiʿad and his lands of Taʾliqum and all of his property there and the property of his father Yismāʿʾīl and the pro-
perty and irrigated fields and wādī-side plots and houses and lands which the two of them had inherited from their father Sumhūʾafaq bin Sumhūyafaʿ, King of Sumʿay, in the countryside and in town; and his irrigated field of
Nuʿmān which Yuhʿān had acquired and purchased from Bakrum and Hawfāʿathat and Himmatʿathat and Hawtarʿathat and from Hawtarʿathat and ʿAmmīshafaq and Yuhʿān and ʿA-
mmīsamaʿ and Ganiʾum and Ẓarrum and their brothers of the lineage of Riʾbān; and his wādī-side plot of Dhū-Sumhūʿalay on the way to the agricultural land attached to Ḥadaqān which he had gained possession of and acquired from ʿAmmīshafaq
bin Sirwam, qawl-official of Yarsum; and his wādī-side plot of Dhāt Daʾikh. And he acquired through mutual agreement its property-rights through a gift which his father and paternal uncles, the qawl-officials of Yuhaybib had bestowed, which
the kings of Mārib and the tribe of Samaʿ had bestowed: the tilled area of the wādī-side plot of Dhū-Daʾikh. And in accordance with the pact which Karibʾīl Watar, King of Sabaʾ, had established for him; and in accordance with the gift and the pact which
the tribe of Samaʿ had established and bestowed; and in accordance with pact and the edict which Yithāʿkarib bin Dharaḥʾīl bin Yuhafriʿ Dhū-ʿUrranhān had established. And as for his wādī-side plot of Ḥayiś … …
and acquired and gained possession of … ….

bibl.seg: Avanzini, Alessandra 1995. As-Sawdāʾ. Inventaire des inscriptions sudarabiques. 4. Paris: de Boccard / Rome: Herder. [Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-lettres; Istituto italiano per l'Africa e l'Oriente]
